FuncDef:
The fr lmi t392dce command configures a period (T392) during which a DCE waits for a status enquiry message from a DTE.
The undo fr lmi t392dce command restores the default configuration.
By default, the T392 value is 15s on the DCE.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a period (T392) during which a DCE waits for a status enquiry message from a DTE.
The value is an integer ranging from 5 to 30, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Local Management Interface (LMI) is a protocol that uses status enquiry messages and state messages to maintain link and PVC status, and its working process is as follows:
A DCE requests a status enquiry message from a DTE at an interval specified by T392. If the DCE does not receive a status enquiry message during this interval, the DCE records the error and increases the number of error events by 1. If the number of error events is greater than the error threshold, the DCE considers the physical link and all VCs unavailable.
The value of T392 must be greater than that of T391.
Prerequisites
The FR interface type has been set to DCE using the fr interface-type command.
Configuration Impact
Running the fr lmi t392dce command changes the period during which a DCE waits for a status enquiry message from a DTE. The period affects the error threshold, which in turn affects the LMI negotiation rate.
If the fr lmi t392dce command is run more than once, the latest configuration overrides the previous one.
